job_title: Human Resources Business Partner, Talent Management in Moon Township, PA
pros: I've been at the University for almost two years. One of my favorite things is the passion that the staff has for what they do--from the gentleman who cares for the greenery, to the President, people get excited about what they do and do it with pride. Nearly every person that I've met and worked with is kind, smart, and proud to be part of the institution. As a place that began it's story with a commitment to diversity and inclusion, offering professional development and career opportunities for women, at a time when that wasn't common at all. Overall, we do what we say we will do.
cons:
College students are hard to come by.
In our region, there's a lot of competition for college students.
Without college students, we don't have the budget we once had.

job_title: Health Care Administration in Pittsburgh, PA

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Moon Township, PA
pros: Big enough to matter, small enough to care.  At RMU, employees have the opportunity to get involved in a wide variety of projects that better the University.  The organizations is always looking to improve what is currently being done.  Very student centered.  No matter what job or department, we are all here for the students and that is a good feeling!
cons: Parking during the academic year can be tight.  Some of the buildings are old and run-down.  Similar to many historical college campuses.

job_title: Hockey and Figure Skating Private Instructor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great pay! The best part was that as a private instructor you are able to make your own schedule which makes your work/life balance so much easier!  If you enjoy working with kids this is a great job for you.  Overall a positive work environment.
cons: None that truly negatively impacted me or my view of working there.  Sometimes the parents of the kids you coach can be difficult but that is because their child is their main priority and most parents want their kid to be the best.  Just treat them with respect and smiles help!

pros: RMU has excellent staff members who make you feel welcomed and they definitely work as a team! There is no micro managing, and although there are goals you definitely don't have to worry about missing your numbers and losing your job. Instead of blaming the employee RMU takes a look at other outside factors that play a role in student enrollment. You are practically in charge of yourself and they offer excellent benefits and great PTO days. This is the type of job you can stay at, it is a career.
cons: No cons so far, they are on the right track as far as student success and employee happiness!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Moon Township, PA
pros: The students will always be the best part of working at a University.  I love to see them grow and graduate.  There are a lot of good programs here to make sure they graduate with diverse experiences.
cons: There is no chance for advancement here.  You work hard for very small incremental raises.  There seems to be no sense of urgency to care to do what it takes to retain good workers.

pros: Nice place to work.  The benefits as an employee are extremely helpful.  You can take advantage of discounted education costs for yourself and children.  There will usually be opportunities to grow as well.  The quality of your experience will always depend on the people you are reporting to.  There are many great people/leaders at the university but there are some that are very poor.  Your experience will really depend on your department and supervisor.
cons: There are many politics so you must be prepared.  The pay is not always the best since they try to leverage some of the additional benefits you receive when working at the institution.

job_title: Student Life Director in Moon Township, PA
pros: Most employees and students are wonderful. Benefits are pretty good. Lots of comp time and a very fun low-key atmosphere during breaks.
cons: Vice Presidents make all the critical decisions with only superficial understanding of what their staff does. Some decisions are obviously tied to VP bonuses. Pay is about 20% below market average. Everyone has been at RMU for 2 years or 20 years. Anyone with ambition is gone after 2-3 years because pay stinks and the never-leavers block opportunities for promotion.

review_title: Generally a good place to work but parking is a nightmare...
pros:
RMU offers a competitive pay rate in the local market and pays at a higher rate for teachers who have a specialized skill set in their area of expertise.
Additional pay for attending faculty meetings
Supportive departments
Nice colleagues
cons:
Little flexibility in syllabus design
Paying $66 / year for parking and still not being able to find a space anywhere near the building where you work

pros: A working environment that supports its staff generating consistent interest in our programs and course of study to all prospective students within our community and abroad.
